1.Summary: "Great Place For Young Adults And Students"
1.Pros: Very Good Place To Work. Schedules And Hours Ate Good And They Have Flexible Scheduling Techniques. Very Friendly And Professional.
1.Cons: Nothing The Job Has Been Great

2.Pros: Cool co-workers (Sometimes)Better pay then other fast food restaurantsPerfect starter job
2.Cons: Managers aren't equally trained, so you can have a good manager one day and a terrible manager the next.OverwhelmingA lot of hiring and firing all at onceManagement isn't terrible, but a lot needs to be fixedFranchise Owner hiring terrible people to look after his stores.

3.Pros: Mcdonalds is a good job to start with. It will help with experience and patience. It will also help a young teen be independent.
3.Cons: There are going to be customers that get mad or complain but you cant let it effect on how well you do your job.

4.Pros: Decent experience and helped build my resume
4.Cons: Terrible pay and management is awful.

5.Summary: "Fun but upper management is not good"
5.Pros: Great people great place to grow and become more independent
5.Cons: management became very disrespectful once they got their manager uniforms

6.Summary: "It was nice for a while, but after I moved to 2nd shift with school everything went down hill."
6.Pros: They are very flexible with your schedule and do have a lot of good managers working there. I found it really fun to work there on the weekends with the morning crew.
6.Cons: If you are working there with school on 2nd shift you won't be able to have a social life, and you will realize how bad some of the managers on 2nd shift are.

7.Pros: Flexible hours if the management likes you
7.Cons: Hectic work environment that is fast paced

8.Pros: Great people, Good environment, yummy food!
8.Cons: Not enough employees in work place

9.Cons: Not a steady schedule but secure
